channel.title: FøroysktDaily / @ForoysktDaily
channel.description: Twitter feed for: @ForoysktDaily. Generated by nitter.cz

item.title:
The #Faroese #WordOfTheYear 2023 is #vitlíki - artificial intelligence. It comes from words #vit (intelligence, brains) and #líki (equal, like)
The #ársinsorð has been chosen from the shortlist provided by the listeners of the "Góðan morgun Føroyar" programme
#føroyskt #AI
item.dc:creator: @ForoysktDaily
item.description:
The #Faroese #WordOfTheYear 2023 is #vitlíki - artificial intelligence. It comes from words #vit (intelligence, brains) and #líki (equal, like)

The #ársinsorð has been chosen from the shortlist provided by the listeners of the "Góðan morgun Føroyar" programme

#føroyskt #AI

item.title:
RT by @ForoysktDaily: Against all odds
#FaroeIslands (population 55.000) has beaten many giants on the path to our first-ever European Handball Championships. The #EHFEURO2024 is in Berlin. Over 5K or 10% of our population has gone to #Berlin to support the team
🇫🇴 💪
item.dc:creator: @VisitFaroe
item.description:
Against all odds

#FaroeIslands (population 55.000) has beaten many giants on the path to our first-ever European Handball Championships. The #EHFEURO2024 is in Berlin. Over 5K or 10% of our population has gone to #Berlin to support the team

🇫🇴 💪

item.title:
The M/F #Teistin #ferry used to operate the route between #Skopun and #Gamlarætt before the #Sandoyartunnilin tunnel opened in December 2023.
Built in 2001 on #FaroeIslands in #Skála, its name translates to #guillemot (Cepphus grylle).
#føroyskt #StrandfaraskipLandsins
item.dc:creator: @ForoysktDaily
item.description:
The M/F #Teistin #ferry used to operate the route between #Skopun and  #Gamlarætt before the #Sandoyartunnilin tunnel opened in December 2023.

Built in 2001 on #FaroeIslands in #Skála, its name translates to #guillemot (Cepphus grylle).

#føroyskt #StrandfaraskipLandsins

item.title:
#Hvalvík (pop. 262) lies by the #bay, where pilot #whales have long been driven ashore and beached - hence the name.
The #church in Hvalvík is the oldest of the traditional #Faroese wooden black churches.
#FaroeIslands #FaroeseCities #føroyskt #Streymoy #grindadráp
item.dc:creator: @ForoysktDaily
item.description:
#Hvalvík (pop. 262) lies by the #bay, where pilot #whales have long been driven ashore and beached - hence the name.

The #church in Hvalvík is the oldest of the traditional #Faroese wooden black churches.

#FaroeIslands #FaroeseCities #føroyskt #Streymoy #grindadráp

item.title:
#Streymnes (pop. 320), located in #Saksunardalur by the river #Stórá, was first mentioned in 1584. Its name comes from words #streym (stream) and #nes (headland).
The #FaroeIslands first #whaling station was built at nearby #Gjánoyri in 1893.
#FaroeseCities #føroyskt #streymoy
item.dc:creator: @ForoysktDaily
item.description:
#Streymnes (pop. 320), located in #Saksunardalur by the river #Stórá, was first mentioned in 1584. Its name comes from words #streym (stream) and #nes (headland).

The #FaroeIslands first #whaling station was built at nearby #Gjánoyri in 1893.

#FaroeseCities #føroyskt #streymoy

item.title:
#Syðradalur (pop. 6) on #Kalsoy was founded by inhabitants of #Blankaskáli. They decided to move after the #avalanche devastated their homes in 1809.
#Blankaskáli, now abandoned, is believed to be the oldest settlement on #Kalsoy.
#FaroeseCities #FaroeIslands #føroyskt
item.dc:creator: @ForoysktDaily
item.description:
#Syðradalur (pop. 6) on #Kalsoy was founded by inhabitants of #Blankaskáli. They decided to move after the #avalanche devastated their homes in 1809.

#Blankaskáli, now abandoned, is believed to be the oldest settlement on #Kalsoy.

#FaroeseCities #FaroeIslands #føroyskt

item.title:
#Hvítanes (pop. 97) was settled in 1837, mostly by people from #Kollafjørður. Nowadays it's a part of #Tórshavn municipality.
The shore here is often battered by hard white #surf which covers the entire #seaside - hence the name of the village.
#FaroeseCities #føroyskt
item.dc:creator: @ForoysktDaily
item.description:
#Hvítanes (pop. 97) was settled in 1837, mostly by people from #Kollafjørður. Nowadays it's a part of #Tórshavn municipality.

The shore here is often battered by hard white #surf which covers the entire #seaside - hence the name of the village.

#FaroeseCities #føroyskt

item.title:
#Sandavágur (pop. 985) enjoys the view of all the southern islands in the #FaroeIslands.
Its name comes from #Faroese words #sanda (sand) and #vágur (small bay) and refers to sandy beach which used to be much bigger.
#FaroeseCities #føroyskt
item.dc:creator: @ForoysktDaily
item.description:
#Sandavágur (pop. 985) enjoys the view of all the southern islands in the #FaroeIslands.

Its name comes from #Faroese words #sanda (sand) and #vágur (small bay) and refers to sandy beach which used to be much bigger.

#FaroeseCities #føroyskt

item.title:
#Lopra (pop. 87) lies on #Suðuroy and may date back to a pre-#Norse settlement of Gaelic #hermits from around 6-8th century AD.
Its name may also have the #gaelic origin - the word #lobar which translates into #leprosy.
#FaroeseCities #FaroeIslands
item.dc:creator: @ForoysktDaily

item.title:
RT by @ForoysktDaily: Klaksvik has gone and done it again
Completely unbelievable.
item.dc:creator: @ivanlapanje
item.description:
Klaksvik has gone and done it again

Completely unbelievable.

item.title:
#Sørvágur (pop. 1152) lies on the island of #Vágar. Its name can be of #OldNorse origin - coming either from words #seyr (sand) or #saurr (mud, dirt).
The place can also be named after #Sørli - the first man who is believed to settle here.
#FaroeseCities #FaroeIslands
item.dc:creator: @ForoysktDaily
item.description:
#Sørvágur (pop. 1152) lies on the island of #Vágar. Its name can be of #OldNorse origin - coming either from words #seyr (sand) or #saurr (mud, dirt).

The place can also be named after #Sørli - the first man who is believed to settle here.

#FaroeseCities #FaroeIslands

item.title:
#Gásadalur (pop. 13) is situated in a deep valley (#dalur)
It’s said its name comes from a woman named #Gæsa - the wife of a 12th century bishop - who according to legend was the one who founded the village
#gása is also a #Faroese word for a goose
#FaroeseCities #FaroeIslands
item.dc:creator: @ForoysktDaily
item.description:

#gása is also a #Faroese word for a goose

#FaroeseCities #FaroeIslands

item.title:
R to @ForoysktDaily: #Faroese #linguist and scholar Jakob Jakobsen proposed that the island name #Mykines derived from mykr/mykja ‘muck’ + nes ‘headland, cape’ (relating to the huge amount of bird droppings to be found there).
#føroyskt #FaroeIslands
item.dc:creator: @ForoysktDaily
item.description:
#Faroese #linguist and scholar Jakob Jakobsen proposed that the island name #Mykines derived from mykr/mykja ‘muck’ + nes ‘headland, cape’ (relating to the huge amount of bird droppings to be found there).

#føroyskt #FaroeIslands

item.title:
#Mykines (pop. 15) is the only settlement on the westernmost #Faroese island. It’s the only place where the #gannet nests.
The peculiar name of the island likely has #Gaelic roots. It originates from the #Celtic words *Muc-innis meaning pig-island.
#FaroeseCities #føroyskt
item.dc:creator: @ForoysktDaily
item.description:
#Mykines (pop. 15) is the only settlement on the westernmost #Faroese island. It’s the only place where the #gannet nests.

The peculiar name of the island likely has #Gaelic roots. It originates from the #Celtic words *Muc-innis meaning pig-island.

#FaroeseCities #føroyskt

item.title: R to @ForoysktDaily: #Víkarbyrgi was heavily hit by the #BlackDeath in 1349 - only one woman, called #Sneppan survived the plague. The long isolation meant that she did not want to have contact with others. She did not die of hunger, thanks to men from #Sumba who hoisted dried meat down to her.
item.dc:creator: @ForoysktDaily
item.description: #Víkarbyrgi was heavily hit by the #BlackDeath in 1349 - only one woman, called #Sneppan survived the plague. The long isolation meant that she did not want to have contact with others. She did not die of hunger, thanks to men from #Sumba who hoisted dried meat down to her.

item.title:
#Víkarbyrgi (now #abandoned) was in the #MiddleAges one of the largest settlements on #Suðuroy. It is considered one of the oldest settlements in the #FaroeIslands.
Its name comes from the #Faroese words #vík - bay and #byrgi - enclosed place / animal shelter.
#FaroeseCities
item.dc:creator: @ForoysktDaily
item.description:
#Víkarbyrgi (now #abandoned) was in the #MiddleAges one of the largest settlements on #Suðuroy. It is considered one of the oldest settlements in the #FaroeIslands.

Its name comes from the #Faroese words #vík - bay and #byrgi - enclosed place / animal shelter.

#FaroeseCities

item.title:
#Morskranes (pop. 15) lies on the west coast of #Eysturoy.
Its name - according to Eivind #Weyhe - may come from strongly inflected form of the #Faroese noun #skurur - young bird of lesser black-backed #gull (#LarusFuscus).
#FaroeseCities #FaroeIslands #føroyskt #fauna
item.dc:creator: @ForoysktDaily
item.description:

#FaroeseCities #FaroeIslands #føroyskt #fauna

item.title:
R to @ForoysktDaily: The #Skælingsfjall mountain was long thought to be the #FaroeIslands highest.
The original name of the mountain used to be #Skælingur. Later on it got the #fjall suffix (mountain) to tell it apart from the village.
item.dc:creator: @ForoysktDaily
item.description:
The #Skælingsfjall mountain was long thought to be the #FaroeIslands highest.

The original name of the mountain used to be #Skælingur. Later on it got the #fjall suffix (mountain) to tell it apart from the village.
